p: Data from the current COVID-19 pandemic are limited. One study among patients with diabetes and COVID-19 reported that preprandial and postprandial glucose levels were above target in 29.4% and 64.5%, respectively, whereas 10% suffered at least 1 hypoglycemic event [ 99]. Details of their antidiabetic therapies, outcomes, or comparison with a control group were not reported. Anecdotal reports from experts caring for COVID-19 patients note a higher incidence of hyperglycemia, new-onset diabetes, diabetic ketoacidosis, and euglycemic ketoacidosis [ 100].
